intro: Chitonia pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramid sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, pyramid-shaped mantle. The plant, more accurately a mollusk, has a soft body covered in a layer of mucus and lacks a true shell. It feeds primarily on algae and is often found in shallow coastal waters. Its coloration can vary, but it typically exhibits a range of hues including yellow, orange, and red.
